TEXT.TITLE: WHITE HOUSE CHIEF HAS NO SECRET TAX PLAN
TEXT.BODY:
White House chief of staff Howard Baker said he has no secret plan to raise taxes. Talking to reporters, he pointed out that, "Ronald Reagan is president. I am chief of staff. His program is my program." I have no tax plan at all." Baker's comments came in response to a question as to whether he planned to support higher taxes to reduce the budget deficit. President Reagan has said repeatedly that he opposes higher taxes.
